messages.title: UKIP says YES to
messages.content: An NHS free at the point of delivery - UKIP will give £3 billion extra to the NHS to keep it free. No tax on the minimum wage - UKIP proposes that workers on the minimum wage should not have to pay income tax at all. Housing priority for local people - UKIP proposes building social and low-cost housing on existing sites not on green fields, to help local youngsters get on the ladder. Affordable energy - UKIP wants to invest in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear, and reduce subsidies for solar farms.

messages.title: UKIP says NO to
messages.content: Unlimited immigration - UKIP wants to control immigration to prevent lower wages and pressure on housing and services. £55m a day membership fees to the EU - UKIP believes Britain would be better off out of the EU. £12 billion a year in foreign aid - UKIP wants to reduce foreign aid that subsidizes space programs in countries like India and China. The 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax' - UKIP opposes these taxes and advocates for simpler and fairer tax systems.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP supports an NHS that is free at the point of delivery and proposes an additional £3 billion funding to maintain its free access.
UKIP proposes that workers on the minimum wage should not have to pay income tax.
UKIP advocates for giving housing priority to local people, focusing on social and low-cost housing solutions on existing sites, not on green fields.
UKIP supports investing in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear, while reducing subsidies for solar farms.
UKIP supports controlling immigration to prevent lower wages and pressure on housing and services.
UKIP believes that Britain should leave the EU to avoid £55m a day in membership fees.
UKIP wants to reduce foreign aid, especially that which subsidizes space programs in other countries.
UKIP opposes the 'bedroom tax' and the 'mansion tax,' advocating for a simpler and fairer tax system.

issues.immigration: UKIP wants to control immigration to prevent lower wages and pressure on housing and services.

housing.content: UKIP advocates for giving housing priority to local people, focusing on social and low-cost housing solutions on existing sites, not on green fields.

quotes.text: Labour are lying to you about UKIP and the NHS.
